rComments: Faye is bae!!!! She teaches the best research methods class at UCSC. If you can take a class with Faye, you must take advantage of it. Not only will she make research methods fun and share with you her tremendous knowledge in psychology, but you will grow to love her.

Faye was great! I was dreading taking this class because I'd heard it's hard, but Faye made it easy. She is witty and clearly cares about her students and the subject she is teaching. You can go to her with any problem and she will offer any service she can provide. The TA's are also great, tough graders but still very helpful.
One of the best seminar classes there exists. Very inspiring.

Learned a lot in this class! For a methodology course, the lectures were highly entertaining. Two big group papers in this class; hope you get good teammates and a nice TA! There's a little extra credit and some good participation buffers. Quizzes are OK... re-read the lecture notes and take the pre-quizzes before each actual quiz.

I love Faye!!! She's one of the best professors I've ever had. Humorous, inspirational and approachable. She leaves a lot of opportunities for serious students, and MAKE SURE YOU START WITH A GOOD GROUP OR YOU ARE SCREWED FOR LYFE. Research methods sounds like a terribly boring class but it was one of the best psych classes evar

This class functions like a well oiled machine.  It is a wonderful experience.  Everyone involved is really helpful, there are 21 people who teach the class, and there's always someone to help if you have questions.  Laid out in a very easy and manageable fashion if you keep up with the work.

Areat professor. MAKE SURE YOU GET A GOOD IA it will make all the difference. Faye is a wonderful teacher and is very enthusiastic.Some parts can get dull but overall the class isnt too bad. Stick around for the end-of-the-course-suprise!

Faye is funny and charismatic. She takes a dull topic and teaches it in a very structured and well-organized way. No textbook for this class just a reader that she helps you pay for if you can't afford. Class mostly based on papers that are written in a group and you get to conduct your own experiments! Very hands on approach to teaching research.
She's one of the most charismatic and fairest teachers I've ever had at UCSC. I strongly recommend taking her classes.

Okay so I was an IA for psyc 100 -- not a student or a TA, but an IA. She was awesome as an overseer of being an IA for psyc 100, and I had a great time making friends and being in close contact with Faye. Be an IA if you can, I highly recommend it. The psyc 100 class is also quite enjoyable as I remember.

Faye is good at her job. She knows what it takes to keep the class interested and does it. Lectures aren't mandatory. All notes are given out at the beginning of the quarter. Study those before quizzes. Research papers aren't bad. GET YOUR TA TO EDIT. They grade it so they know exactly what to look for. Suck up and go to office hours to clarify.

This is the first class where I feel liked I learned something. Faye is hilarious and her class is actually enjoyable to attend, especially considering the the subject of the class is not exactly exciting.

Faye is a smart lady. The class seems a little too easy, but it does get you prepped for writing research papers. Inequality amongst TA grading was the only thing that really ticked me off. But the professor is wonderful, her quizzes are easy, just make sure to study for the "weeding out" exams.
Don't take research methods with anyone else! She makes the class easy and fun. Plus, free food in sections and the possibility of free coffee in class if it's early in the morning.

Had Faye for Psych100. She makes little booklets for you and you pay $20 for it. It's all her slides plus some readings and a bunch of resources. It's great! Study guides for her quizzes (which are easy if you study!) and guidelines for essays. She also has coffee every lecture and snacks every lab! She explains concepts that relate to real life

So I had Faye TWICE. (will write 2nd review for 2nd class). First time I had her was in Psych 1 and I'm so glad she was the last one. Save the best for last! She's one of the best teachers I've eve had. Really good at explaining concepts and just so understanding of students and their perspective. Straightforward with exams. love her!

I LOVE FAYE! She's so cute and sweet. Her lectures are very clear. As long as you go to lecture, you'll ace the quizzes. She is very positive and engaging, and she shows a lot of interest in knowing her students and giving them the help they need. The TAs are a hit or miss. Try to get a good one because they'll be the ones grading everything!

FAYE IS AN AMAZING TEACHER! She gives great examples and as long as you attend and pay attention in lecture you will have a great understanding of the concepts. She gets fantastic TAs although some are hard graders. A lot of writing is involved and group work can be an issue in the class. Faye couldn't be better at teaching though.

Crosby is a GREAT professor! One of the best I've had so far! Wonderful educator. She cares a lot about the students and how well we do in the course. There was no textbook, but a binder with pdf files, which were her lectures. Every lecture was always interesting and loved how she gave out candy when students would answer her questions!

She treated our class like we were disobedient children.Her lectures are boring and unhelpful and her guidelines for papers were contradictory.As soon as attendance and grades drop she would send out emails and give lectures telling us what horrible students we were. None of the TAs kneW what was ever going on. AVOID AT ALL COST.

Faye is awesome & very approachable! She explains concepts clearly & makes lectures interesting. She throws candy for answering questions & raffles prizes for getting 100% on quizes.  Some of her quizes can be difficult, but if you pay attn in class & take notes, it's not too hard. No text book-just a notebook w/outline of her pwr pt slides.

I want to adopt this woman as my 3rd grandma. She is adorable and hilarious. She takes the essential material for a research methods course and makes it very accessible and easy to learn. She explains things very well and throws out candy during class to people who participate. TA's are very helpful as well. She is taking a year off, back Fall '08?

Great teacher. She puts the difficult material about Research Methods into layman's terms. She picks the best TA's. The papers aren't difficult as long as you split up the parts. Quizes are easy, just pay attention to the things in the reader that she goes over in lecture. And when in doubt... BELIEVE ME, contact the TA's, they know EVERYTHING.

Faye takes research methods (an admittedly dry class) and makes it as fun as possible. She loves teaching, and it's obvious she wants all the students to succeed. Every time I talked to her she listened and was helpful, she even had great suggestions for experiments and seemed to genuinely care about the results. Excellent teacher!

Although the subject matter isn't the most exciting, Faye made the class a lot better. She is a fun professor, and very kind. The class has a great packet, so you don't have to stress about taking notes because she has all her lectures in it already. Grades are based on weekly quizzes and 3 huge papers. No tests, no real homework. If you pay attent
She is great!
She's a very boring teacher..

By the look of the rest of the reviews, maybe Faye changed the way the course works, I had it about two years ago and it was a fiasco to say the least. I wasn't happy with the constraints on the "experiments" in particular. The lack of control/confounds in the measures used defeated the purpose to conducting/practicing what we were learning.

Faye is awesome. She made research methods actually kinda fun. She's very approachable and knowledgable. She cracks jokes before and after class, and is really committed to helping students. Not a hard class at all. I highly recommend her for research methods, and for a 50+ year old woman, yeah, she's totally hot!
Very fun class....wonderful teacher. Very nice lady and funny

VERY helpful professor. She really knows what she is talking about, and will go out of her way to make sure that her students understand the material.  She makes Research Methods a FUN class to attend.  Perhaps the best teacher I've ever had so far.
She's awesome and amazing and really eager to help the students
No Comments

i have taken several classes with faye and she is a superb teacher. her social psychology of social justice is a must, as is her affirmative action 2 credit class.... if she still teaches psych 1 i would highly recommend taking it when she is one of the professors....
Awesome. best teacher for psych 1. soooo much better than birdgeman.
she has been by far the only teacher that could keep me awake for two whole lecture hour. She's amazing.
Faye is the best! He lectures were informative and interesting. She managed to keep me awake for the two hour lectures. She's just a really good professor and person. I highly recommend her.

She is *really* nice.  Powerpoints could use some work.  Fairly clear assignments and tests.  Relies a *lot* on T.A.'s.  Research Methods turned out to be a *lot* less painfull that I expected it to be thanks to Faye.  She treats students well.

Pretty good teacher. Had the tendency to talk down to students, but was overall a very fun professor. Lectures were interesting and clear. Often tried to involve students in the lecture which usually made for a less boring class. The best Psych 1 teacher, as far as I'm concerned.
faye was a great lecturer, she engaged the students and her lectures were straight forward and clear.  i really enjoyed her section of psyc1

Faye is a pretty cool teacher. She is really interested in helping the students pass the class. If you have a problem with something and tell her or your TA about it, she it fairly flexible. She uses slides which helps a lot with notes. Gave candy out the whole quarter and a surprise on the last day

decent professor, but talked down to students as did the text (when it wasn't over-intelectualizing basic definitions). don't get on her bad side, though, or you might find yourself in a lot of politics with the dept.

she was clear, used powerpoints (which can be printed out beforehand), and kept the class engaged. not once did i fall asleep during a lecture. im a firm believer that profs make the learning experience good/bad and faye did an excellent job keeping (most) students interested.
she taught the information well and made it easy to pay attention.  the class was interesting and well taught
If you have to take Psych 3, take it with Crosby! Easiest 'A' ever if you know how to work it. All of the quizzes were straight from the notes, and there's no final! Very little reading, no homework.
Professor Crosby was an excellent psych professor, she has a commanding knowledge of the field and clarity in her presentation. She always managed to make my day with her positive attitude.

Faye is one the most understanding, sympathetic professors I have ever had.She always asks for student feedback.Most psych majors dread the 7 credit class, but Faye's approach to it made it pretty simple and easy.At times she can be a little vague, but if you just tell her she will clarify.

Crosby was a horrible teacher. She is full of herself, the primary text book had a page written by her! Her opinion is the basis for much of her boring lectures. Other psychology profesors are much better.
She was my favorite teacher of the 3. Her lectures were very clear and all of her powerpoint presentations were online so you could always print them out before class. Definitely a great teacher!!
She is the teacher that I disliked the most and I found her section of Psychology 1 the hardest.  I also found it difficult to understand what she was trying to get across.
Very nice professor, my favorite out of the three.  Engaging lectures.
very good professor. i recomment her!
her lectures are very basic as well as her test. her test is the easiest out of the three lecturers.
Some of her lectures were interesting, some seemed they came right out of the book.  Her test was somewhat difficult, but she knew what she was doing.
No Comments
She is very aware of what's enough material to introduce and what's too much.

People b trippin saying all this**** about how she's "super subjective when it comes to her job". She's an amazing teacher!!!!!! Let me also say that anyone that does not incorporate their own life into their own job IS NOT DOING THEIR JOB. She tells a lot of motivating stories that are profound to our development as Psych majors!Pay attention in

On the first day of class she showed us a video about how much she loves Obama and then cried because her son and his husband just adopted a baby and how disturbed she was that gay marriage law was going to be repealed. She uses her teaching position to promote her political opinions. I felt it was inappropriate and did not have a place in lecture

If you are taking this course for the IS requirement: don't. This class is full of busy work and overzealous undergraduate TA's who literally stalk students during lecture and tell them to pay attention. Mandatory sections where we did word finds and talked about our feelings. So much busy work. Her tests are deliberately tricky. No curve.

Completely amazing professor. Her professionalism and organization make the class so easy to handle. Her lectures are very engaging - lots of games to lock in the info. She teaches in a way that you learn tons, yet you don't feel overwhelmed. I would highly recommend her. Best professor I have ever had.

I really liked Faye to begin with. She is very organized and really structured the class/material perfectly. However as class went on e-mails/mini lectures about how we were horrible students/some of the worst she'd ever had/etc became the norm. As an enthusiastic Psych Major I found her VERY discouraging and the worst professor Ive had at UCSC.

One of the worst professors I have had in my academic career. The class is not difficult because all you do is memorize terms, but the work load is ridiculous. She thinks more of herself and the class than is necessary and tries hard to convince you of her political opinions.

Really great professor! I really hope to have her again for future psych classes! She is the best out of all three! Her test was really straight forward and if you studied,  it was super easy. It's just memorization of the terms. Just study and you will do great.

Controlling and not very straightforward. An interesting lecturer; knows her stuff but not concise about the way she presents the material.  Let me put it this way: any class can be made to be difficult if you twist the material enough. I agree with the person who said she is too personal also that she treats the class like children.

Ran the class like a preschool. Had an army of T.A.'s who roamed the aisles telling students to be quiet and handing out slips of paper to go and see Faye after class if you were naughty! Rigid and required sections where you play games instead of discuss the topics. Too personal about her politics. Rote memorization and busy work abound.
She was my favorite among the three professors who taught the class. She was funny, engaging, and clear. Easy B on her test. I will definitely try to take her again.
Faye was an amazing lecturer but her test portion for Psych 1 was very tricky! I read all the material in the book and on the study guides and I still got a C+
Really was a great professor. The most amazing professor I've had as far as help, very patient and willing to go out of her way. Can't speak highly enough of her.
She was awesome. She made the material fun and easy to understand. She can be funny from time to time which is a plus. Her part of the class was my favorite.

she is amazing and i love her to death!!! she makes the class interesting and fun and you actually want to be there. I wish I had such a dedicated teacher for all of my classes. she really cares about each of her students and is very clear and organized.

Professor Crosby's lectures were not that boring because she told stories and gave examples. But the exam was hard and tricky! She'll give answer choices that have one psychologist and the rest are theories as well as "all of the above" or "none of the above."
Good teacher. Keeps things interesting by telling stories.

amazing professor. she is one of the reasons why i'm happy to be a psych major. extremely helpful. lecture were very clear. just follow the notes! three "papers" and daily quizzes. no midterm/finals. worked with a group on three of the papers and you are responsible for one section each time(intro,method,etc).
Faye Crosby is a very nice woman and knows her psychology, and knows how to teach it. She is not afraid to speak her opinion and is very liberal.

Here's how Faye introduced herself on the first day: Faye decided to play a Barack Obama music video, then showed a picture of her son who could not marry bc he's gay and started to cry. She doesn't understand the difference between teaching and preaching. A public university should not employ teachers like this that abuse their academic positions.
Really good examples and very interactive. She taught the 3rd part of psych 1 which was social psych.
